data.text: @Gunntwitt @mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa Ha ha ha. NO on the playstation et al.  I'm going to stage it with a tropical bent so that mom can envision herself hanging out there also. In case there are no millennials. Lol.  It can also be a game room.  OR, just a second master. Could house 4 rugrats.

@hipEchik @mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa You did, as far as I'm concerned.  Will you stage it with a PlayStation and dirty laundry strewn about?  There's a fine line you need to walk between reminding the paying parents, and giving them hope they can survive it.

@Gunntwitt @mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa Thank you! Did I invent that? It's how I will stage it. We are using it as an office but there's another room that can be an office. It's THE perfect millennial apartment. French doors to a huge balcony that overlooks the hills. Totally private. We've slept out there on hot nites

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa New buyer can replace if they hate it. Meanwhile, there are french doors, galore. A second master which can be a millennial apartment, etc. Hill views from front and back. It's a unique home for a masterplanned community. It'll be hard to leave it.

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa I had an upgrade budget and I think we used it well. The only issue at resale is going to be the kitchen countertops. I LOVE them but the new buyer may not. They look nice but are a composite. Corian or something but I'll tell ya, zero scratches. They held up well.

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa I've not moved a lot but that was our thinking in this place and we did upgrades with that in mind. They all have held up to the test of time (17 years).  Our realtor really guided us in that regard. I'd only owned a condo prior but my dad flipped homes so I had good instincts

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa Funny. everything old is new again. My parents had marble in their circa 60s homes in the SF bay area. I always liked it but it was black.  I am more worried about staining and durability than looks. I just dig quartz so much. No granite. I'm not a fan of granite at all.

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa Oh,  good to hear because it's what I want. You have it in the kitchen only? I am wondering about using it in the bathrooms as I want to in this place. Is it white? I want white quartz in the bathrooms here.  And then in the new home kitchen.  I have some white quartz floors

@mom_grateful @tarekelmoussa I didn't put granite in here as my realtor said it stains horribly.  I think the same is true about marble.  In fact, I know it is. I really am in love with quartz right now and that will go into our next place. Maybe this place too as we re do two of the bathrooms.
